result.execSummary:
The defendant Randolph D Zich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Negligently Provide Imp.Animal Shelter-Sanitation, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 951.14(4).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**AMENDED 11-19-2015:  To reflect the correct amount of credit for time served.**
**AMENDED 7-2-2015:  Term of probation is 2 years.**

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No VIOLENT contact with the victim.  Defendant may not own any animals or have any animals in the home.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, including parenting classes. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

ATTY Tran files petition for review of bail.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  Contact with victim as permitted by Department of Human Services.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol or controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.   $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail. Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) to monitor - 524 S Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780).  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Randolph D Zich in court with attorney Nhu H Tran.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Kim Slaasted.
Defense indicates that there is also a misdemeanor case and a global offer. The State indicates that defense has rejected the global resolution so the misd. case will be reissued as a felony. The State indicates that there is a misd offer on 14CF343 and the State will leave that offer open for 60 days only. Defense is asking for STC for 60 days and a JT date on the calendar.
Defense asks that conditions of bond WITHOUT MOTION. Defense is asking bond to be modified to contact as permitted by DHS.  The State feels modification as requested may be a bit premature considering the posture of the case. The State asks that bond remain as set until the next court date.

BTC: Bond to be modified to state "Contact as permitted by Department of Human Services"  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Randolph D Zich in court with attorney Nhu Huong Tran.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Kim Slaasted.
Defense filed bond motion to remove SCRAM. ZCI has removed the SCRAM unit due to financial units. Defense asks that deft be required to report to ZCI 3 times a week but that SCRAM be removed. The defense asks that deft be allowed to have contact only as permitted by DHS. The State opposes all the requested modifications of bond. The State opposes SCRAM being removed and notes that there are also charges pending in Misd. court. The State indicates that if deft cannot cover the payment for SCRAM, that deft be taken into custody. 

The Court conducts a colloquy with the deft's wife regarding contact/HSD issues.  The Court conducts a colloquy with the child victim. 

BTC: bond modification is granted to allow removal of SCRAM but deft must report to ZCI every day when they are open at varying times of the day. Deft may have contact with son, wife and other family members as is approved and supervised by HSD.  There is to be NO unsupervised contact with the child victim. Deft shall participate and comply with any DHS requirements including any AODA treatment and programming and parenting classes.
